abstract: George Vecsey Sports of The Times column examines United States Soccer's rehiring of Bruce Arena as men's coach, replacing Jurgen Klinsmann; says Arena is right choice for job, with 2018 World Cup qualifying on line.

headline.print_headline: Project Turns to Architect It Knows Well
headline.main: Bruce Arena, Replacing Jurgen Klinsmann as U.S. Coach, Keeps Things Simple

keywords.value: United States Men's National Soccer Team
keywords.name: organizations

snippet: Arena, who has won five M.L.S. titles and five N.C.A.A. titles, will lead the Americans for the balance of this World Cup cycle after having coached them in the 2002 and 2006 Cups....
lead_paragraph: Arena, who has won five M.L.S. titles and five N.C.A.A. titles, will lead the Americans for the balance of this World Cup cycle after having coached them in the 2002 and 2006 Cups.
